content.webTitle: Vieira's agent wings in for talks with Real

fields.headline: Vieira's agent wings in for talks with Real
fields.bodyText: The Patrick Vieira saga took another twist yesterday following Spanish reports that the player's agent will meet Real Madrid today to discuss a possible £25m transfer. Arsenal have made an official complaint to the Football Association about the agent, Marc Roger, and handed over alleged proof that Vieira has been illegally approached by a number of clubs. The FA's compliance unit is investigating the claims. The Spanish newspaper As claims Roger will meet Real's sports director Jorge Valdano in Madrid even though Arsenal have not given any club permission to negotiate a transfer. Arsenal are reportedly about to make an offer for the Greece Under-21 defender Stathis Tavlaridis, who impressed on a recent trial. Chelsea's interest in Real Madrid's defender Geremi has been confirmed by the player: "My agents, the leaders of Real and Chelsea are in negotiations." Spanish reports claim Chelsea are also interested in Real's Steve McManaman. Benfica's Ukraine defender Sergei Kandaurov, available on a Bosman, is holding talks with Aston Villa, who yesterday completed the formalities of Olof Mellberg's £5m move from Racing Santander. Watford are about to sign Kaiserslautern's Albanian striker Igli Tare for £900,000 and Gaizka Mendieta completed the formalities of a £30m move from Valencia to Lazio. Blackburn's £1.3m Turkish midfielder Tugay Kerimoglu has been granted a work permit to link up with the club on their pre-season tour of Austria and Germany. Ipswich have agreed a fee with a Spanish side for an unnamed international, thought to be Deportivo La Coruna's 31-year-old midfielder Fran.
